main.title: Welcome to Mica!
main.subtitle: Mica allows you to browse studies and, for those with administrator rights, edit them.

lastname.maxlength: Your last name cannot be longer than 50 characters

email.maxlength: Your e-mail cannot be longer than 50 characters

error.dontmatch: The password and its confirmation do not match!

newpassword.maxlength: Your password cannot be longer than 50 characters

confirmpassword.maxlength: Your confirm password cannot be longer than 50 characters

messages.error: An error has occured! The session could not be invalidated.

caching.title: Caching
caching.help: Various caches help Mica to be more responsive. Depending on the cache settings, the retention policy can vary a lot (time out, memory and/or disk persistence etc.). See server documentation for more details. After a cache was deleted, it is rebuild during the flow of queries. Dataset variable statistics can be rebuild explicitly, making Mica more resilient when a remote Opal server is down.
caching.opal-taxonomies-help: Taxonomies from primary Opal server. To be cleared after taxonomies have been updated in Opal.
caching.mica-config-help: Mica system various settings. Cache is automatically cleared each time the configuration is updated.
caching.aggregations-metadata-help: Acronyms and names of published studies, networks etc. that are used to decorate search results. Cache is automatically cleared each time a new publication is made.
caching.dataset-variables-help: For each dataset, variable summaries are extracted from remote Opal servers. Cache is automatically cleared after a dataset is published.
caching.agate-subjects-help: Users details are cached once retrieved from Agate server. To be cleared to synchronize with updated user details.
caching.authorization-help: Anything accessed in Mica requires authorization.

errors.title: Error page!
errors.403: You are not authorized to access the page.

config.title: General Configuration
config.name: Name
config.name-help: Name of your organization that will be used when sending notification emails.
config.publicUrl-help: Public base URL of the server that will be used when sending notification emails.
config.languages-help: Supported languages for studies, networks and datasets descriptions.
config.opal-help: This Opal server is the source of variables and data summaries when no study-specific one is defined.
config.privacy-threshold-help: No data summary will be returned if the number of participants is below this threshold.
config.opal-credentials-help: When Mica needs to connect to remote Opal server, some credentials must be provided for authentication. These credentials can be based on an encryption key pair (HTTPS only) or a user name and password. See also Opal data access administration documentation.
config.encryption-keys-help: HTTPS connection requires to have a private key and a public key (certificate) defined. A self-signed key-pair is available by default. You can provide your own.
config.openAccess-help: Access to published documents is opened to everyone.
config.roles-help: List of available roles for studies and networks.

numberOfParticipants.label: Number of participants
numberOfParticipants.sample: Target number of participants with biological samples
numberOfParticipants.suppl-info: Supplementary information about target number of participants

study.label: Study
study.name: Name
study.objectives-help: What are the principal objectives of the study?

access.label: Access
access.for: Access to external researchers or third parties provided or foreseen for

study.documents-help: If applicable, please provide relevant documentation about the study (e.g.: Study Protocol).

authorization.label: Authorization
authorization.maelstrom: Authorization from contributors to the Maelstrom catalogues
authorization.specific: Authorization from contributors to the [specific network] catalogues

study.opal-help: URL of the opal server for this study
study.delete-conflict-message: Found conflicts when trying to delete study. Remove dependencies and try again.

revision.update-comment: Add a comment to describe the changes.

search.placeholder: Search by first name, last name or institution...

dataset.name: Name

datasource.title: Data Source
datasource.info: Reference to the Opal table from which variables and data summaries will be extracted from.

study-table.title: Study Table
study-table.info: A study table defines which study data collection event it applies to and which Opal table the variables and data summaries are to be extracted from.

study-tables.title: Study Tables
study-tables.info: The study tables define implementations of the Data Schema variables. The data summaries will be extracted from the corresponding Opal tables.

restore-dialog.title: Restoring Dataset from Revision
restore-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to restore this revision from '{{arg0}}'?

dataset.project-help: Project name from the study's Opal server (if this one is defined, otherwise the project is expected to be found in Opal primary server).
dataset.project-dataschema-help: Project name from the Opal primary server.
dataset.table-help: Opal table name from which variables and data summaries will be extracted.
dataset.table-dataschema-help: Project's table name from which variables will be extracted.

data-schema.title: Data Schema
data-schema.info: The variables of the Data Schema are the reference variables of the Harmonization dataset. This is a simple data dictionary: no data summaries will be extracted from the Opal table.

data-collection-event.name: Name
data-collection-event.delete-dialog-message: Are you sure you want to delete the collection event?

delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete the network '{{arg0}}'?

study-delete-dialog.title: Delete Study
study-delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete the study '{{arg0}}'?

restore-dialog.title: Restoring Network from Revision
restore-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to restore this revision from '{{arg0}}'?

permission.help: Grant permission to Read, Edit or Review the current draft.
permission.label: permission
permission.reader-help: Read-only access to the document in draft mode with its revisions and its associated files.
permission.editor-help: Edit access to the document in draft mode with its revisions and its associated files. Publication or permanent deletion are not permitted.
permission.reviewer-help: Full access to the document, including its publication, permanent deletion and permissions.

delete-dialog.title: Delete Permission
delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete the permission of {{arg0}} {{arg1}}

access.help: Grant Read access to the publication.

delete-dialog.title: Delete Access
delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete the access of {{arg0}} {{arg1}}

help.general: Configure Opal server, locale and server properties.
help.security: Configure encryption and Opal server credentials.

error.403: Server rejected your request, please make sure you are logged in and try again.

file.invalid-paste: You can not paste in the same path.

data-access-request.title: Title
data-access-request.title-help: Short summary to help identifying the request.
data-access-request.documents-help: Select one or more documents to be attached to the application form.

delete-dialog.title: Delete Data Access Request
delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete Data Access '{{arg0}}' request by '{{arg1}}'?

submit.invalid: The request cannot be submitted because of an incomplete application form.

validation.success: Your request form is complete and ready to be submitted.
validation.error: Your request form is incomplete, please correct the errors.

status-change-confirmation.title: Status Change Confirmation
status-change-confirmation.message: Are you sure you want to {{arg0}} this access request?
status-change-confirmation.message-review: Are you sure you want to put this access request under review?

data-access-request.parse-error: Form content is not a valid document, please contact your administrator for more help.

data-access-config.title: Data Access Configuration
data-access-config.title-field-help: The title of the request will be extracted from the application form model according to the specified JSON field path.
data-access-config.saved: Data Access Form is successfully updated.

pdf-template.title: PDF Template
pdf-template.info: The data collected in the web application form can be rendered in a PDF file. A PDF template is to be provided with field names matching the application form schema.

schema-form.title: Application Form
schema-form.info: The web application form can be specified both in terms of data structure (schema) and data display and validation (definition). See form schema documentation for more details.

schema.info: The form schema specifies the data structure.

definition.info: The form definition specifies how to display the schema and how to validate the data inputs.

model.info: The form model stores the valid input data, invalid values are excluded.

id-generation.title: ID Generation
id-generation.info: The ID of the data access requests can be generated following a pattern.
id-generation.prefix-help: Generated IDs will start with the specified text.
id-generation.length-help: Length of the generated part of the ID (i.e. not including the prefix).

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.info: Emails can be sent to applicant and data access officers when an event happens on the data access request. Events can be: status change or comment. Notification email subjects can contain the following placeholders: ${organization}, ${title} and ${id} for the request id.
notifications.submitted-help: Email is sent to data access officers and to applicant on data access request submission.
notifications.reviewed-help: Email is sent to applicant when its data access request is being reviewed.
notifications.approved-help: Email is sent to applicant when its data access request is approved.
notifications.rejected-help: Email is sent to applicant when its data access request is rejected.
notifications.reopened-help: Email is sent to applicant when its data access request is reopened.
notifications.commented-help: Email is sent to applicant and data access officers when the data access request is commented.

workflow.title: Workflow
workflow.info: The data access request goes through several steps. Some minimum settings can be applied to control this workflow.
workflow.with-review-help: Between the submission and the approval/rejection of the data access request, an intermediate state can be used to inform applicant that its request is being processed.
workflow.approved-final-help: If not final, an approved data access request can be reinstated to its previous state.
workflow.rejected-final-help: If not final, a rejected data access request can be reinstated to its previous state.

syntax-error.definition: Form definition is not a valid document, please revise and correct the errors.
syntax-error.schema: Form schema is not a valid document, please revise and correct the errors.

parse-error.definition: Form definition is not a valid document, please contact your administrator to configure the form definition.
parse-error.schema: Form schema is not a valid document, please contact your administrator to configure the form schema.

delete-dialog.title: Delete Comment
delete-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to delete this comment by '{{arg0}}'?
